newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: C&W unit sets 271.4 mln peso cable project.
newsitem.headline: C&W unit sets 271.4 mln peso cable project.

text.p: Eastern Telecommunications Philippines Inc (ETPI), an affiliate of Cable and Wireless Group, said on Thursday it would embark on a 271.4 million peso cable investment programme.
For 1997, it has earmarked 90.26 million pesos to invest in several cable systems to enhance links with Hong Kong, Saudi Arabia, Europe and Southeast Asia, ETPI said.

"Increasing competition, both in the domestic and international front, has given us the impetus to further expand Eastern Telecoms' capabilities as an international telecommunications service provider," ETPI vice chairman Luis Sison said in a statement.
ETPI is 9.8 percent owned by Smart Communications Inc, an affiliate of Philippine conglomerate Metro Pacific Corp.
